text: This is a Wikipedia passage about micky moody. Micky Moody (born Michael Robert Moody, 28 August 1950) is an English guitarist, best known for his work with Whitesnake, Juicy Lucy, Snafu, and The Snakes. He has also released several solo albums. Moody was born in London, England. He began playing guitar at the age of 12, and by the age of 15 he was playing in local bands. He joined Juicy Lucy in 1969, and played on their first two albums. He then joined Snafu in 1974, and played on their first three albums. In 1978, he joined Whitesnake, and played on their first five albums. He left the band in 1982, and went on to form The Snakes, with whom he released two albums.
